abstract.text: Tells the file provider to create or import an item based on a template.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: An object that defines the state of the new or imported item.
The fields that you should apply to the new or imported item.
If the item is a file with the
field set, this is the URL to the item’s content. Otherwise, it’s
The item creation options.
An object that identifies the context of that request, such as the requesting app.
A block that you call after uploading the item to your remote storage. You pass the following parameters:
The newly created item.
Any fields that you haven’t yet applied. If you can apply all the fields at once, pass an empty
instance.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the system should fetch the item’s content from your remote storage.
If an error occurs, this object contains information about the error; otherwise, it’s
A progress that tracks creating the item in your remote storage and uploading its content. The system automatically calls
on the progress object when an error occurs.

The system calls this method when the user creates a new item or imports an item into the file provider. The system manages the local copy of the item. You’re responsible for syncing and saving the item to your remote storage.
Implement this method to create an item in your remote storage that matches the template, and then call the callback handler.
The
parameter describes the item’s intended state, including:
The item’s name.
The item’s type. The item can be a file, directory, symlink, or alias.
, and
types typically need special handling.
The item’s location.
The system sets the template’s
to a unique value and guarantees that it remains the same for the specified item. For example, the system can reuse the identifier to replay this method after a crash.
In general, set the properties in your
to match the
. One exception is the
property; always provide your own identifier for the item. If you reuse an existing identifier, the system replaces the local copy of the old item with the new one.
If the item is a document, fetch its contents from the
parameter. Otherwise, the
is
. For symlinks, you can access the content using the template’s
parameter. For both symlinks and aliases, make sure to return the correct UTI for the item,  because the UTI can’t be inferred from the item’s filename.
If you are reimporting an item and the system finds a local copy without any content, it sets the
option, and sets the
to nil. In this case, if you can’t match the item with an existing item from remote storage, pass
as the completion handler’s
parameter. The system then deletes the local copy of the item.
If the attempt to create an item fails because the parent directory doesn’t exist, pass
to the handler. The system attempts to create the parent directory, and then tries to create the item again.

abstract.text: A type that represents an alias file.
A type that represents a user-browsable directory.
A type that represents a symbolic link.
Cancels progress tracking.
An extension other apps use to access files and folders managed by your app and synced with a remote storage.
Options for creating items.
An option indicating that the item may already exist in your remote storage.
Options for deleting items.
An error indicating that the specified item doesn’t exist.
An item the File Provider extension manages.
Fields that specify which of the item’s properties have changed.
The item’s content.
The item’s Uniform Type Identifier (UTI).
The item’s filename.
The item’s persistent identifier.
The persistent identifier of the item’s parent folder.
The target of the symlink.
Options for modifying items.
A File Provider extension in which the system replicates the contents on disk.
Tells the file provider to create or import an item based on a template.
Tells the file provider to delete an item forever.
Tells the file provider that an item’s content or metadata changed.
An object that provides information about the application requesting data from the File Provider extension.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.
An object that conveys ongoing progress to the user for a specified task.
An object representing the location of a resource that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A value that identifies the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
